A few hundred yards along the main road is El Corte Ingles - department store open until about 22.00 selling everything from food to furniture, as well as several really quite good restaurants - try La Bo Tiga, excellent tapas served in a chic environment or my favourite (because it's authentic traditional Spanish) the restaurant L'Antull tucked away in a back street just behind the hotel (go down the ramp, turn right, immediately left down narrow alley, then right after 100 yards and you will see it on the corner) - doesn't look like much, basic decor, great fish, and if you get on with the waiter, as much agua diente you can handle! Don't bother with restaurant Si Senor right by the hotel - more like No Senor, bad food, service etc. Hotel rooms however are not great - clean certainly, but lacking charm, and not great prices either. However, on the 4th floor there is the executive lounge which serves free food and drink all day (no one seems to bother checking if you have an exec room!). Public areas are modern and reasonably comfortable with good bar service. Meeting rooms are very good but pricey - get your own lunch sent in or go out. Service at this hotel is excellent, any problems quickly resolved; all staff are cheerful and friendly. I would give the hotel 5 stars overal if it were not for the rooms as mentioned already.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Prices minus the Hilton Quality”
Reviews.Author: Loader2001
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay in the downtown area, great location. Short walk to shopping center and university. Staff is very friendly and helpful, however, for 225.00 Euro, I say it is not worth the price. The bed was the only thing that was not run down. Rooms are small and unimpressive (It actually reminded me of a dorm I lived in while in the military). I stayed in other cities in Spain at nicer "resort" hotels for 1/2 the price with more to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: ADavies
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an excellent stay in the Hilton Barcelona! Went to watch the football so hotel is an ideal place as the Nou Camp is only 10mins walk around the corner. The hotel has a few restaurants close by and it is on Avenue Diagonal which has loads of high class shops. The Hilton is a 10 euros taxi ride from La Ramblas so is not too far from the main centre of town. The hotel itself was excellent, all the staff spoke good English and they could not have been more helpful. We had breakfast each morning and there was plenty of choice and the standard of food was excellent. The bar was excellent as well, especially the friendly bar man Phillipe who spent a great deal of time talking about football and Barcelona with us. Very impressed with the hotel and when we return to Barcelona (which will be soon as we loved it!) we will come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: mdp_az
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is not worth its rating or high rates. Thankfully we stayed here only 2 nights for my wife's business meeting, so it cost us nothing. Our first floor room was at the back of the hotel overlooking the nicely manicured park with palm trees, so it was quiet, but I would imagine the rooms up front on Av. Diagonal would be rather noisy. The decor of the lobby seemed mismatched and cheap. The decor in the room was downright budget. It reminded me of a modern youth hostel and had a very institutional feel. The carpet in the room had an odd texture and was not very clean. There was not quite enough storage in the room, and the lighting was a bit poor. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was very nice, aside from the ugly brown marble tiles. The location of the hotel was convenient to a metro station and shopping mall, but little more. The breakfast was decent, but the coffee of rather poor quality. The staff was very accommodating and helpful and spoke great English. One staff member in particular, a gentleman named Yves, was extremely polite and helpful. The staff indicated to me that this is a well run hotel, but one that is in dire need of a remodel, a price adjustment, or both. Do yourself a favor and do not stay here if travelling to Barcelona as there are many nicer hotels in better locations with lower rates.

Reviews.Title: “not worth five stars”
Reviews.Author: wilson17
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this rather unimpressive Hilton. The location is not near the interesting tourist areas nor any of several international conference centers, but does have a convenient Metro nearby. The staff was uniformly nice, helpful and able to communicate in English-this was really the best feature of the hotel. The lobby was very nice, but elevators small and not always working. The room was small but ok size for European standards, but in need of renovation, or at least painting. No iron or other useful amenities in room, very expensive internet access (23 Euro daily for mediocre connection). The bathroom was clean and everything worked well. The bed wasn't bad, but not one of the best, although several nice pillows helped. No pool and tiny ill-equipped gym. The breakfast was included in my package but was more appropriate for a 2-3 star hotel-bad weak coffee and limited, below average quality buffet. Pricy, uninteresting lunch and dinner menus, which I didn't try, but meals at meeting not high quality. Overall, not so bad for the brief meeting I attended, but I would choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: vouviajar
Reviews.Content: Dried poop on the brown marble floor and it had been there for a while. Because of the lines in the marble it was hard to detect . I was shocked to find out that it had hardened and blended into the floor. Housekeeping was alerted and we were moved into another room, but only after I insisted. Boring & outdated lobby and rooms. Windows would not open. Worse Hilton I have ever stayed in, they should remove it from the chain. Watch the floors!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service. Decor needs some touching up”
Reviews.Author: globeseekerpa
Reviews.Content: It's rare that you can be in an urban setting and see palm trees swaying from your hotel window. The Barcelona Hilton pulls it off with a great location on the tree-lined Avinguda Diagonal. It's walking distance to restaurants, a shopping center, and a Metro station. The staff is multi-lingual and friendly, I heard them assisting guests in English, Spanish, German, Portuguese, and French. The rooms are comfortable if cold and sterile. They were redone in a modern IKEA-type style with silver metallic fictures and really lack any type of warmth or personality. However the beds were comfortable, the air conditioning was blowing cool air, and there was a good variety of TV channels. The lobby also is looking a bit dated, it definitely does not match the decor of the rooms and has an awkward combination of low ceilings and a slightly tired "atrium." But overall the great location,comfortable rooms, and good service make the Hilton a fairly good choice for a Barcelona stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is some kind of joke? Maybe not”
Reviews.Author: Earby
Reviews.Content: A 5 star? certainly 5 star price even with a discount but for this kind of money I want more than this, and know I can, and have got more from 3 stars. The gym is dire, decrepit, and moribund! No pool, no sauna, no anything. Not very likely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CNPH
Reviews.Content: Stayed there due to a conference nearby. The hotel is on Avenue Diagonal, a few blocks to the subway, close to a shoping mall that looks like an office building, (because it is combined). Not a huge convention-type Hilton. Rooms were very clean, modern/sparely furnished but adequate. Speakers for tv in bathroom were a nice touch. If you like long walks it's easy to get to La Ramblas, Plaza de Catalunya, Calle Gracia, and the wonderful Gaudi buildings. May not be the greatest price, didn't compare because was there for business. Always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: brooke16
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona with my mom stepdad and sister and a few friends 2 summers ago and I loved this hotel. I tend to be very picky about where I sleep especially when it comes to hotels and I still to this day believe that I have never slept better in a hotel. I had a room on the executive floor that I shared with my sister. The room was beautiful, very modern with a nice sized dark marble bathroom. I read a previous review from a traveller staying on the executive floor and was shocked.. I find it surprising that they found anything negative about these rooms. The temperature was also wonderful for me as well. The rooms very smoking rooms I believe, and I am not a smoker but there was not even a lingering stench of ciggerette in there. The area was nice, more in the financial district then the main las ramblas area but a short cab ride away. They have a huge delish breakfast buffet but the price is steep at 20 Euros a person.. I loved this modern beautiful hotel. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - ideal for the Nou Camp”
Reviews.Author: Rmorrison
Reviews.Content: We where upgraded to a club level room on arrival , the room was clean and comfortable. The club level ameneties where fantatsic, food and drink served in the club lounge , all complimentary and plentiful. The hotel is perfectly located to the Nou camp ( the reason for our visit). We would love to go back , and would choose the hotel again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Naora
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 10.00am and had a complimentary early check-in. Stayed in a Deluxe Room. The room is simple, comfortable bed and clean. The taxi fares from the Airport to the Hotel is around €20. Breakfast cost €22. Had a full selection of cheese, yogurts, pastries, good selection of hot items and fruits. Good service. You can get cheaper for your meals outside of the hotel. At the nearby restaurants. There is Si Senor (Mexican Restaurant), Starbucks next to Si Senor and shopping centres, El Corte Ingles within walking distance (5 minutes). The staff of the hotel was helpful and friendly. The location was great and located at Av. Diagonal! 7 minutes walk to the train station (M). Shopping centres and shops within walking distance. Turn left to El Corte Ingles (Big departmental store) and right to other shops. It is not in the city centre, 15 minutes to La Ramblas by car. Shops close at 8pm. Good value for money and Yes! I will definitely come back to this hotel with my family!

Reviews.Title: “Great - save the austere rooms”
Reviews.Author: MrSoft
Reviews.Content: Getting straight to the point - the rooms really are just as depressing as the hotel photos suggest. Probably it all looked great on the designer's sketches. But the reality is, teenage bedsit by IKEA. One has to question the wisdom of using aluminium sheeting on working surfaces. The desk has no drawers and quickly becomes a total mess. The lighting is cold and bright, like a fridge. After 3 nights it was seriously having a bleak effect on me. I did not enjoy returning to my room at all. Lights out . . . to be disturbed by the smoke alarm, whose green light flashed all night long, right above my head. Everything else was first class. Staff throughout the hotel excellent, the best I encountered in Europe for a long time. The Business Centre staff downstairs were particularly good. Lobby and bar/cafe both very nice, breakfast terrific. A bit pricey but there's a nice little regular cafe just across the entrance if you want to save your money. Wireless ludicrous at 27 euro per day, and connection very slow. All is undermined by the rooms. Time to refurb the refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Fe3O4
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at this hotel on Friday Sept. 29 thru Monday Oct 2, 2006. We used Hilton points for this room and received Executive level room & concierge service. Our room was 508. The room is pretty much as other reviews have stated. Pictures are attached. It's not the best hotel room in the world but it was fine. It certainly is far from the worst room. I would not consider this as a resort hotel. It's pretty much all business. If you are traveling to Barcelona for business for a couple or three days, this place gets the job done. All of the staff we encountered were great. The front desk and concierge were very cordial and helpful. English was spoken so no language problems for us at all. The concierge level had food & drink available from 7AM - 11PM. This was really nice. Food was spotty at times. Breakfast was OK. We primarily used this as a break from touring Barcelona by stopping in to have a few snacks and drinks. It worked great for that. The Freixenet Cava sparkling wine was fantastic. We buy that at home now. As for the restaurant on site, don't know. We never utilized it. Hotel location is on Av Diagonal. According to the tour bus, this is the most expensive shopping district in Barcelona. It was also stated that this is the longest shopping street in Europe. A Metro stop is about a 5-minute walk to the left as you come out of the hotel. Tram stop is practically across the street. To get to the nearest Hop-On Hop-Off tourist bus is a good 20-minute walk down Diagonal. Come out of the hotel turn right and when you come to Starbucks on the corner that is the bus stop for both the red & blue lines. The red line is for the north city tour and the blue line is the south city tour. Two day bus pass was 24E. Bottom line - would I stay at this hotel again? Yes, but I would look for another location first.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pedro56
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for three nights but it was magnificant. The staff were friendly and very helpful. They could not do enough! The breakfast has the biggest choice we have ever seen. There was nothing missing that we could see and if there was I am sure it would have been provided. Available from 7am to 11am every day is also very good. No rushing down before it closes. Bedroom was good. Bed very comfortable. Excellent power shower. Loads of TV channels and some Radio stations. Quite a lot of in-house movies though we didn't bother with them. Only short corridors from lifts makes a real pleasant change. No long treks to room - fantastic. The lifts are amazing. They are so silent. You press the button and it arrives before you know it. Silently!! The design and decor is very modern. We loved it. Nowhere seems to mention this but the Metro station is Maria Christina about 300 metres away. From the airport take R1 train to Sants Estacio (2.60 Euros) and change to L3 to Maria Christina (1.20 Euros). Total 3.80 Euros. Much cheaper than a taxi and dead easy. Get a ten trip Metro ticket for 6.85 Euros - excellent value. We didn't use them but there are loads of buses right outside the hotel as is the tram. Taxis are everywhere. Coming out of the Metro station turn right towards the Hilton. You cross over a very busy underpass and a busy junction. There on the corner is El Corte Ingles - a fantastic department store. Everything you will ever need is there. In the basement is a large supermarket - again with everything. Excellent prices too. On a par with the larger Carrefour supermarkets elsewhere in Spain. Buy drinks here and put them in your mini-bar to keep cold. Save yourself a fortune. Next to El Corte Ingles is another shopping centre with lots of VERY nice shops. Also quite a few VERY nice food places downstairs - good for lunch and quick snacks. For a reasonable price meal turn right out of Hilton and walk about 1Km to GINOS. Very friendly, good food, good prices. Around the corner to the right from GINOS is La Bo Tiga - a new contemporary eatery. Great staff, great ambiance, great food and stunning prices. It is bright and new. It is also a great place to eat. The city is well documented elsewhere but in just 3 days we had an excellent time. Lots and lots of walking - the best way to see a city. We never got to La Rambla though. Go there .... and don't forget the cable car over the harbour - take your camera!! PW & GS

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: Alex0021
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in this hotel, I think the room are ok, but found them very unwelcoming, and try to have a modern side which is not working at all. Bathroom was nice. The staff were very nice and friendly. Just thought a deluxe room lacked a lot of charm and character. Parking is way too expansive, for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location is a bit outside but not bad”
Reviews.Author: cla114
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit better than your average Hilton, rooms are a bit newer, however given that in Spain you can go to very nice stilish 4 star hotels, this one is not the best of all. I was on the executive floor and so rooms were supposedly a bit better than the rest, however the bathroom was old and, most important, THEY DID NOT HAVE NON SMOKING ROOMS ON THE EXECUTIVE FLOOR!! So the floor and the rooms smelled of cigar.... Apart from this the location is not so central but not in the outskirts either, it's a residential area, so for businesspeople it's ok, for tourists maybe less. Overall a good hotel but not the best in Barcelona.
